learning_outcomes.description: Understand at a deeper level the complex nature of problems and methods in your discipline.
Reflect critically on arguments presented in contemporary and historical debates.
Demonstrate reasoned thought, creativity, and a high level of written expression.

assessments.task_description:
The requirements for the Honours thesis vary by discipline. Your supervisor and Discipline Honours Advisor will provide more detailed information and guidance.

  • Students in Ancient History write one thesis of 20,000 words.
  • Students in Greek or Latin write one thesis of 16,000 words plus original translations.
  • Students in History write one thesis of 16,000–20,000 words.
  • Students in Philosophy write one thesis of 16,000–20,000 words.
  • Students in Religious Studies write one thesis of 16,000–20,000 words.


This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 26(24 Feb - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Thesis research and writing

Students research and write their Honours theses, in consultation with their thesis advisor. Early in semester students should meet with their advisor to establish an agreed schedule for regular meetings and completion of agreed tasks.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04

Early in semester students should meet with their advisor to establish an agreed schedule for regular meetings and completion of agreed tasks.
